metadata.titel_preek: Father, into thy hands I commend my spirit

locutie.beschrijving: The preacher explains Jesus' final words on the cross within the context of Luke's Gospel, emphasizing the battle against darkness and the relational nature of 'Father'.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong historical-critical and intertextual focus (Psalms, other Gospels, apocalyptic context).

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting theological truths and narrating biblical history, with a late shift toward invitation and promise.
voorbeelden: Luke continues, 'And having said this he breathed his last.'
The cost of forgiving one's tormentors is huge.
Your crucified Lord holds out his arms to you.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: The hearer should feel comforted by Christ's victory and eventually surrender their own life to God.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Low; the Spirit is not explicitly mentioned as the agent of the word's efficacy.

voorbeelden: The Psalms have always been the foundation for Jewish and Christian prayer.
Luke envisions Jesus waging a battle on the Cross.
He was so utterly secure in himself.
We are not to think of Jesus slipping delicately...
Let these words sink into your ears.
You can make these words your own.
I remember reading a letter...
I confess that is enough for me.
I will never forget what he meant to me.
In his abandonment we find our acceptance.
The Father of Jesus has his hand on you.
The love that will not let you go.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Implicitly strong but often phrased as general truths rather than direct personal promises.

voorbeelden: In his suffering we find our redemption.
You will not be exactly the same person as you were before.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher relies on the authority of the quoted Maclaren rather than speaking directly in persona Christi.

indicatoren: Extensive historical description of Luke's style
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of a historical/theological drama rather than a participant.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The 'event' of the sermon is delayed until the very final paragraph.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: High quality but low frequency; concentrated at the end.
voorbeelden: The Father of Jesus has his hand on you in some way.
Your crucified Lord holds out his arms to you.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address to the reader/listener, mostly in the conclusion.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to apply the benefits of the cross.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing Jesus, Luke, the Devil, and 'the Christian life'.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a lecture-like atmosphere for the first 80% of the text.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Theological definitions (e.g., 'The Christian life is lived...').

actueel_present.gebruik: The immediate moment of the sermon's conclusion.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: The sermon moves from Assertive (Theology of the Cross) to Commissive (The Father's hand on you).
voorbeelden: In his suffering we find our redemption... The Father of Jesus has his hand on you.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The transition is late but effective.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Your crucified Lord holds out his arms to you... Now I give myself to thee.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions primarily as a high-level theological and literary commentary on Luke's passion narrative, only becoming a 'sacramental event' in the final moments.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The connection between Psalm 31 and Jesus' prayer.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The long section on Luke's literary style vs Mark.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Delays the encounter between God and the hearer.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It becomes an event only at the end; before that, it is a reflection on an event.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher speaks mostly *about* the grace of God rather than *dispensing* it through the word until the final paragraph.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Implicitly, through the quoted words of Jesus.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Weak; the preacher presents himself more as a fellow-meditator.
tekstueel_bewijs: I found some words in a sermon by Alexander Maclaren...

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly left to the hymn and the hearer's response.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Partially; the sermon aims to 'enable' the hearer to give themselves to God.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Only in the final 'The Father has his hand on you'.
tekstueel_bewijs: The Father of Jesus has his hand on you in some way. You can trust that.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is heavy on 'is' and 'was' (Assertives). It needs more 'I promise' and 'He gives' (Commissives).

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: In his suffering we find our redemption.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Through his suffering, Christ redeems you here and now.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a general truth to a direct act of proclamation.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is buried under historical analysis.
voorbeeldzinnen: Because He committed His spirit, your spirit is now safe in the Father's hands.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use the second person to bridge the gap between the cross and the pew.
voorbeeldzinnen: He did not just die; He died for you.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is actually good, just late.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is theologically rich and deeply moving, but it functions more as a lecture until the very end. Increasing the illocutionary force of the promises would transform this from a 'talk about God' into an 'encounter with God'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT reveals that the preacher isn't just 'sending information' but attempting to 'hand over' the hearer to God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The power here isn't in the pathos of the stories, but in the authority of the 'Father' address.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT identifies that the preacher's use of the third person ('Luke tells us') creates a 'constative surplus' that prevents the sermon from becoming a sacramental event until the final address.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The Father of Jesus has his hand on you in some way.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'Seven Last Words' tradition, which naturally lends itself to a more meditative/constative style.
